channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-7902] skipping name rules setting (if already set) should be done on UGI initialization only
item.description: Both TestDelegationToken and TestOfflineEditsViewer are currently failing.
item.summary: skipping name rules setting (if already set) should be done on UGI initialization only

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
TestOfflineEditsViewer also failing with the same reason.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal principal name JobTracker/foo.com@FOO.COM
at org.apache.hadoop.security.User.<init>(User.java:50)
at org.apache.hadoop.security.User.<init>(User.java:43)
at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.createRemoteUser(UserGroupInformation.java:834)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.OfflineEditsViewerHelper.runOperations(OfflineEditsViewerHelper.java:202)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.OfflineEditsViewerHelper.generateEdits(OfflineEditsViewerHelper.java:72)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.tools.offlineEditsViewer.TestOfflineEditsViewer.testGenerated(TestOfflineEditsViewer.java:97)
........
........
Caused by: org.apache.hadoop.security.authentication.util.KerberosName$NoMatchingRule: No rules applied to JobTracker/foo.com@FOO.COM
at org.apache.hadoop.security.authentication.util.KerberosName.getShortName(KerberosName.java:377)
at org.apache.hadoop.security.User.<init>(User.java:48)
... 28 more
Thanks Uma for the quick comment. Revised the summary and the description.
Identified the problem, the skipping of setting name rules is done in the wrong place. working on a patch.

skipping the setting the KerberosName name rules if already set should be done on UGI initialization only (where the initialization is done with a new Configuration()).

When UGI is being configured passing a configuration (ie NN initialization) it should not skip the setting of the namerules.

Failing tests are not passing, check that the tests affected by HADOOP-7887 are also passing.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12506742/HDFS-2648.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1668//console

This message is automatically generated.

Moved JIRA to common as the changes are in common and hudson barks at the patch if in Hadoop HDFS.

The 2 failing HDFS tests go back to green with the patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12506742/HDFS-2648.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 5 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/457//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/457//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1, the patch looks good to me. I'm confident the javadoc warnings are unrelated, since this patch doesn't update any javadocs.
